summary: [Spoilers] Cersie's Fate and how it all ties
title: [Spoilers] Cersie's Fate and how it all ties
body:
So this is going to be a really long, but bare with me because it makes a lot of sense, and I’ve been thinking about it all night.

Now the iron bank is something that’s been talked about in Game of Thrones for a long time, but we specifically saw it come up in the first season with one of Ned’s first scenes with the small Council. So it’s important and I also think it’s important to note that you have Bravos, and that’s the city where the Iron bank is located as well as the Faceless Men. Now here’s where it gets interesting.

Specifically, Syrio is the first sword of bravos, but why is he in King’s Landing and why is he just a dancing master being an important man in Bravos? Well I think that Syrio is actually a faceless man and he is in King’s Landing to Spy, kill, just get close to the small Council, or king and queen because of all if the debt the crown owes. The best way to do this and what he did was to disguise himself. So he became a dancing master because the Hand of the king needed one to train his daughter. Well in him hiring Syrio forel give Syrio that chance to be in the castle close to the king and queen.

Now Syrio’s plan was cut short when all the drama happened with Neds betrayal, and he is forced to fight some of the kingsguard. Well it is supposed he is killed off screen by MT, but we actually never see this. Also he didn’t kill any people of the kingsguard because he had a wooden sword, so there’s really no reason to kill him so I think that MT just took him prisoner.

So basically I think that Syrio is Jaqen h'ghar. When see jaqen h'ghar for the first time he has his face covered possibly because he’s either still Syrio or he just made his transition to jaqen and he’s got his face covered to hide it from the audience. I think at this point he is already plotting to escape and get back to Bravos when he recognizes Arya and from that point on the rest is history.

Now here’s where everything comes into play. When Arya goes to Bravos Jaquen knows about her list. What’s interesting is when they were in harrenhal he told Arya that she can give him three names and he will kill them. Well he’s not allowed to take people because the faceless God didn’t command it so why does he do this? I think it’s only hinting at the parallels between Arya’s list and The Faceless Men having lists in a similar way. I think it’s interesting to note that the waif is asking her who’s on her list and she specifically says are you sure that’s all the people you want to kill because she potentially knows Cersei is on that list.

I think the faceless men let Arya go because Cersei is on her list of names and she is now Queen and since the debt is owed by the crown to the iron bank, they know that she’s going to go kill Cersei which is what they want. Remeber that’s what they want Jaqen was in KL in the first place. I think that he’s sending our in his place this time to do it, and it’s perfect for her story arc of getting the names crossed off her list.

The Faceless Men knew MT was going to be in Bravos, they wanted her to see he was there. When she did kill him and she mentioned that he killed her friend Syrio, she shoved something in his mouth so he couldn’t talk. I think this is because if he did he might have told that he actually didn’t kill him. The writers did this on purpose just like everything else.

Cersei’s conversation with the man from the iron bank was a little sketchy so I don’t think everything’s going to go in her favor in season 8. I don’t think she paid back the iron bank, and I think she took that money and bought the gold company instead. Or she did pay the debt back, and then borrowed more from the iron bank to buy the gold company, and she’s tells them that when she wins the war she will pay it back but we know that she’s probably going to lose and they know it too. However you want to look at it they want her gone.

So I think in the end Arya will mark the last time off her list and kill Cersei. Possibly even using Jamie’s face to fulfill the profecy. It also makes sense of why George RR Martin thought of the faceless men in the first place just for this purpose.

A Lannister Always Pays his debts is their famous quote but I think in the end that will backfire. The Faceless Men, the iron bank, Arya’s list Jaqen, and Syrio, and her finishing her training, Cersie being killed will all be tied together quite nicely.

There is so much more I can say to tired all of this in further detail, but I’m tired now. Hope it made sense. I was typing fast so there is probably many grammatical errors. If you look at the overall picture and imagine and think about things that have happened in the series with the Faceless Men, Arya, Cersei, and the iron bank, then it will all make sense to you. I just can’t cover everything.



Source: https://ift.tt/2GlC60y

blog.name: lj-todd
blog.title: The Wannabe's Corner
blog.description: Small town Canadian writer and gamer dreaming of bigger and better things

tags: a song of ice and fire
title: Jon/Night King
body:
(This is all because of @mischief11things! I should be sleeping right now! I was just getting ready to call it a night and decided to check my phone and saw your new addition to Challenges and I could not rest until this was done! I hope you’re happy with yourself right now!)

(p.s. I’m not really mad about this, in fact it was a blast to write, lol. Also, I’m mixing book!canon with show!canon because show!canon is drastically different than book!canon and I liked book!canon better when it came to the Night’s King tbh)

It started after Hardhome.

After that first true battle against the wights and White Walkers. The undead forces of the Night King.

Jon had slain the White Walker that had nearly killed him, had killed gods only knew how many Free Folk, and he could not say what possessed him to look to the cliffs high above the settlement. He couldn’t say how he knew what was there, what sat astride an undead mount, looking down at him with eyes so blue they were like ice caught in moonlight.

The Night’s King.

Jon had known it to be the being, the myth, Old Nan had told him and Robb as children to frighten them into behaving.

After that battle, the massacre, Jon returned to the Wall with dreams. Haunting things of cold and shadows. Of dragonglass and pain and fear. And love. He dreamed of pale skin cold as ice. He dreamed of a handsome face framed by dark hair turned bitter by the cruel hand of a brother once loved above all else. He dreamed of a voice calling to him.

Even after the betrayal of his men, his brothers at arms, and his mysterious, miraculous, resurrection, he dreamed.

And in those dreams he was held in cold arms and kissed by colds lips as familiar grey eyes turned starlight blue and a name was whispered in the chill of mingled breath.

When he woke, in his old room at Winterfell, having taken back the castle, taken back the North, he knew, as the cold seeped into his bones and stayed there, he knew. Sitting there, staring towards the window, flakes of snow drifting in where he had left it open, Jon knew and, because he knew, he gave voice to knowledge lost nearly eight thousand years ago.

“Eyron.” His breath hung like frozen fog in the air before him. “Eyron Stark. 13th Lord Commander of the Night’s Watch. King of the Nightfort.”

Somewhere beyond the window a crow called and, thousands of miles to the north, beyond the wall, the Night’s King stood, remembering who he had been before, what he had given up when he had discover her in the ice beyond the Wall. Oh, how he had searched and searched for her as he gathered his strength over the millennia, wanting to bring her back, to have her at his side once more only to find her in the most unexpected place.

He found her in the eyes, in the soul, of a boy now fighting an unwinnable battle.

A boy with a wolf’s heart and a dragon’s soul.

A boy who would be his soon enough.

His frozen Queen.

His Jon Snow.

Sitting there, staring towards the window, flakes of snow drifting in where he had left it open, Jon knew and, because he knew, he gave voice to knowledge lost nearly eight thousand years ago.

“Eyron.” His breath hung like frozen fog in the air before him. “Eyron Stark. 13th Lord Commander of the Night’s Watch. King of the Nightfort.”

Somewhere beyond the window a crow called and, thousands of miles to the north, beyond the wall, the Night’s King stood, remembering who he had been before, what he had given up when he had discover her in the ice beyond the Wall. Oh, how he had searched and searched for her as he gathered his strength over the millennia, wanting to bring her back, to have her at his side once more only to find her in the most unexpected place.

He found her in the eyes, in the soul, of a boy now fighting an unwinnable battle.

A boy with a wolf’s heart and a dragon’s soul.

A boy who would be his soon enough.

His frozen Queen.

His Jon Snow.

trail.content_raw:
(This is all because of @mischief11things! I should be sleeping right now! I was just getting ready to call it a night and decided to check my phone and saw your new addition to Challenges and I could not rest until this was done! I hope you’re happy with yourself right now!)

(p.s. I’m not really mad about this, in fact it was a blast to write, lol. Also, I’m mixing book!canon with show!canon because show!canon is drastically different than book!canon and I liked book!canon better when it came to the Night’s King tbh)

It started after Hardhome.

After that first true battle against the wights and White Walkers. The undead forces of the Night King.

Jon had slain the White Walker that had nearly killed him, had killed gods only knew how many Free Folk, and he could not say what possessed him to look to the cliffs high above the settlement. He couldn’t say how he knew what was there, what sat astride an undead mount, looking down at him with eyes so blue they were like ice caught in moonlight.

The Night’s King.

Jon had known it to be the being, the myth, Old Nan had told him and Robb as children to frighten them into behaving.

After that battle, the massacre, Jon returned to the Wall with dreams. Haunting things of cold and shadows. Of dragonglass and pain and fear. And love. He dreamed of pale skin cold as ice. He dreamed of a handsome face framed by dark hair turned bitter by the cruel hand of a brother once loved above all else. He dreamed of a voice calling to him.

Even after the betrayal of his men, his brothers at arms, and his mysterious, miraculous, resurrection, he dreamed.

And in those dreams he was held in cold arms and kissed by colds lips as familiar grey eyes turned starlight blue and a name was whispered in the chill of mingled breath.

When he woke, in his old room at Winterfell, having taken back the castle, taken back the North, he knew, as the cold seeped into his bones and stayed there, he knew. Sitting there, staring towards the window, flakes of snow drifting in where he had left it open, Jon knew and, because he knew, he gave voice to knowledge lost nearly eight thousand years ago.

“Eyron.” His breath hung like frozen fog in the air before him. “Eyron Stark. 13th Lord Commander of the Night’s Watch. King of the Nightfort.”

Somewhere beyond the window a crow called and, thousands of miles to the north, beyond the wall, the Night’s King stood, remembering who he had been before, what he had given up when he had discover her in the ice beyond the Wall. Oh, how he had searched and searched for her as he gathered his strength over the millennia, wanting to bring her back, to have her at his side once more only to find her in the most unexpected place.

He found her in the eyes, in the soul, of a boy now fighting an unwinnable battle.

A boy with a wolf’s heart and a dragon’s soul.

A boy who would be his soon enough.

His frozen Queen.

His Jon Snow.

(p.s. I’m not really mad about this, in fact it was a blast to write, lol. Also, I’m mixing book!canon with show!canon because show!canon is drastically different than book!canon and I liked book!canon better when it came to the Night’s King tbh)

He dreamed of a handsome face framed by dark hair turned bitter by the cruel hand of a brother once loved above all else. He dreamed of a voice calling to him.

And in those dreams he was held in cold arms and kissed by colds lips as familiar grey eyes turned starlight blue and a name was whispered in the chill of mingled breath.

When he woke, in his old room at Winterfell, having taken back the castle, taken back the North, he knew, as the cold seeped into his bones and stayed there, he knew. Sitting there, staring towards the window, flakes of snow drifting in where he had left it open, Jon knew and, because he knew, he gave voice to knowledge lost nearly eight thousand years ago.

“Eyron.” His breath hung like frozen fog in the air before him. “Eyron Stark. 13th Lord Commander of the Night’s Watch. King of the Nightfort.”

Somewhere beyond the window a crow called and, thousands of miles to the north, beyond the wall, the Night’s King stood, remembering who he had been before, what he had given up when he had discover her in the ice beyond the Wall. Oh, how he had searched and searched for her as he gathered his strength over the millennia, wanting to bring her back, to have her at his side once more only to find her in the most unexpected place.

He found her in the eyes, in the soul, of a boy now fighting an unwinnable battle.

A boy with a wolf’s heart and a dragon’s soul.

A boy who would be his soon enough.

His frozen Queen.

His Jon Snow.

blog.name: melissa-blogs
blog.title: The Inner Workings of a Fangirl's mind

summary:
Listen, I know no one cares at this point but that interview had me cackling.
Kit and Sophie have such a brother/sister dynamic...
body:
Listen, I know no one cares at this point but that interview had me cackling.

Kit and Sophie have such a brother/sister dynamic irl, every time he talks abt how “annoying” Sansa is that dynamic just oozes out and it’s the cutest/funniest shit honestly. I literally picture Kit and Sophie having arguments about Sansa and Kit hating on her for no other reason than to piss her off. My mans literally explaining how Sansa saves his life one second, and out of nowhere “this is where I get annoyed… it drives me mad” my mans goes off ??? Like oh you big mad your annoying sister saved your ass??LMao??how annoying??¿¿?

Like you know when you’re playfully flirt-arguing with someone and halfway through you realize you’ve been wrong, but you keep BSing just to piss em off?

That’s Kit.

summary: My unpopular opinion for the GOT show is someone needs to just roll bran’s ass off a cliff
question: My unpopular opinion for the GOT show is someone needs to just roll bran’s ass off a cliff
answer:
Agree

I like Bran in the books and in the first six seasons but dude’s pretty much a mechanical object that can see the past at this point and there’s pretty much nothing else to his character. He’s a plot point and not an actual character. I blame D&D.
